modules.description: Calculates the number of set bits in a 64-bit integer using popcount. Applies specialized bitwise transformations to 64-bit integers through mix64, mix64_variant13, and mix_gamma. Used to generate hash values with distinct bit patterns for testing purposes.

Generates and splits pseudo-random number sequences using a deterministic algorithm, supporting efficient parallel and incremental generation. Operates on a state type representing the internal seed and distribution parameters. Used to create independent random streams for simulations, randomized algorithms, and secure token generation.

Generates and manipulates 64-bit integers through bitwise operations and hashing functions. Key data types include 64-bit integers and hash values, with operations like popcount, mix64, and mix_gamma for transforming and analyzing bit patterns. These functions enable precise control over random number generation and hash distribution. Examples include generating unique hash values for data structures or testing collision resistance in algorithms.
